After an organization initiates a strategic program, several project managers express interest in joining the program team. The program manager's supervisor recommends a list of project managers to be part of the team.
What should the program manager do to select the project managers?

discussion.content:

A. Complete a skill set inventory and select the most suitable resource(s).

Completing a skill set inventory involves assessing the skills, expertise, and experience required for the program and then matching these requirements with the capabilities of the interested project managers. This approach ensures that the selection is based on the specific needs of the program and the qualifications of the candidates, leading to a team composition that is well-suited to achieve the program's objectives.

What should the program manager do to establish and successfully manage the program's direction?

To establish and successfully manage the program's direction, the program manager should ensure that stakeholder concerns and expectations are properly understood and addressed. This will help in aligning the program with the strategic goals of the company and ensure stakeholder buy-in.
